translation.en: [woman] I believe every great leader of their own destiny is fearless.
translation.ko: 두려움을 모르는 리더만이 자신의 운명을 개척할 수 있어요

translation.en: There is no other way to be.
Aware but fearless.
translation.ko: 상황을 잘 인지하되 두려움을 이겨야 해요

translation.en: I am going to make my own decisions in life,
and I'm going to make my own money.
I'm going to buy my own car, make my own way.
translation.ko: 차도 직접 사고 내 길을 개척할 거예요

translation.en: I'm not going to depend on anybody else.
The minute you depend on somebody else, you lose something.
translation.ko: 다른 사람에게 기대는 순간 뭔가를 잃게 돼 있거든요

translation.en: You lose the right to decide for yourself.
You've just got to go for it.
Taking the risks to do things your way can be scary.
translation.ko: 내 방식대로 살려면 위험을 감수해야 해요 정말 무서운 일이죠

translation.en: So you got to be brave.
[woman] Shania changed country music because she went like this,
translation.ko: 샤니아는 당당한 태도로 컨트리 음악의 판도를 바꿨어요

translation.en: "Oh, these are the lines? Cool."
translation.ko: 늘 이런 식이었죠 '날 기다리는 건가요? 그래요'

translation.en: She was the first person to break that door open and go across the music genres.
She was that trailblazer.
Shania does it all. She plays guitar, she writes her own songs,
translation.ko: 샤니아는 못 하는 게 없어요 기타도 연주하고, 작곡도 하죠

translation.en: she has, like, insane live shows.
She was a strong female in country, which is hard because country music's, like,
translation.ko: 여성인데도 컨트리 음악에 큰 영향력을 행사했어요 컨트리 음악 장르에서 성공한 여성은

translation.en: the women don't make it.
You'd have to take a sledgehammer to knock her down.
translation.ko: 샤니아를 쓰러뜨리고 싶다면 큰 망치를 준비해야 할 거예요

translation.en: Record sales. Not streaming.
[man] How many artists have followed huge records
translation.ko: "3회 연속 앨범 판매량 1천만 장 이상 기록" 대박 앨범을 두 번도 아니고

translation.en: with one more, much less two more?
translation.ko: 세 번 연속으로 낸 아티스트가 몇 명이나 될까요?

translation.en: [woman] She might not wear a banner on her hat that, "I'm a feminist."
translation.ko: '난 페미니스트'라는 문구가 쓰인 모자를 쓰고 다니지는 않았어도

translation.en: She just did it.
Shania Twain shifted culture.
She paved the way not only for women in country,
translation.ko: 컨트리 음악뿐만 아니라 모든 곳의 여성 뮤지션을 위해

translation.en: but musicians everywhere.
Are you ready?
[Shania] I said…
are you ready?
[Shania] I spent most of my childhood growing up
in what I would call a medium-sized mining town,
Timmins, Ontario.
[Shania] We were struggling as far as, you know, money.
So there was always a problem paying electric bills,
the rent, um…
Always a problem buying groceries.
So it was just this struggle all the time.
My mom loved music.
Both my parents loved music, so there was always music playing.
translation.ko: 아빠도 마찬가지고요 항상 집엔 음악이 틀어져 있었죠

translation.en: Mostly country music.
I mean, I listened to a lot of Dolly, you know, the Coat of Many Colors.
translation.ko: 돌리 파튼 음악을 많이 들었어요 특히 '코트 오브 매니 컬러스'요

translation.en: So Dolly Parton was a big influence on me.
-My child, how you've growed. -I'm growin', ain't I?
[Shania] She had lived a life that was very interesting,
you know, grew up in a little shack.
With a bunch of kids, not a lot of money.
I was fascinated by her story, and I related and thought, "Well…"
translation.ko: 그녀의 이야기를 들으니 공감도 되고 이런 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "If she came from all the way there and ended up all the way over there…
translation.ko: 돌리 파튼이 저기서 시작해 이렇게 멀리까지 왔다면

translation.en: I guess it's possible."
"Maybe I can…"
"Maybe I have a shot."
[Shania] I was kind of a radio channel hog.
I was the one that was always changing the channel,
finding music that I thought we should listen to in the car. [chuckles]
I would always go for the harmonies just constantly,
you know, singing along.
I think that's probably where my mother would have recognized
translation.ko: 아마도 그때 엄마가 제 재능을 알아채신 거 같아요

translation.en: that I had a different…
ear for music than just the average kid.
She thought I should develop it and become a little singer.
translation.ko: 엄마는 제가 재능을 살려 가수가 돼야 한다고 생각하셨어요

translation.en: At the age of three, my mom would put me up on the counter tops,
translation.ko: 3살 때부터 식당 카운터 위에 엄마가 저를 올려주면

translation.en: and I would sing for the people in the restaurant.
Sing along with the jukebox.
Pretty much anywhere that my mother could find an audience,
that's where she brought me to sing.
translation.ko: 엄마는 관객이 있는 곳으로 저를 데려갔죠

translation.en: I started playing guitar at the age of eight years old.
My dad taught me my first three chords.
translation.ko: 아빠가 처음 세 개 코드를 가르쳐 주셨죠

translation.en: D, G, and A.
[chuckles] I remember clearly.
[Shania] It was my mother's dream for me to become a professional singer.
translation.ko: 엄마는 제가 전문 가수가 되길 꿈꾸셨어요

translation.en: She'd say, "Okay, I'm going to come get you up, uh…
once your dad's asleep,
and then we're going to sneak out and…
go to the bar, and you're going to sing a set."
And, you know, sometimes we would get back, and he'd still be sleeping,
translation.ko: 어떨 때는 그런 다음 돌아와도 아빠가 주무시고 계셨고

translation.en: and other times he'd be waiting for us. Um…
translation.ko: 잠에서 깨 기다리고 계실 때도 있었어요

translation.en: That would not end well.
I was petrified to get up there and sing.
It was okay to go in there as a kid
once the bar was legally no longer serving alcohol,
even though everybody's tables were loaded with their last call drinks.
translation.ko: 물론 손님들 테이블 위에는 마지막 술잔이 가득했지만요

translation.en: It was crazy. I had school in the morning.
translation.ko: 아침에 학교도 가야 했는데 말도 안 되는 일이었죠

translation.en: My mother was obsessed.
There weren't any other kids singing in bars.
I mean, just period.
And it was not the norm. No.
I remember that I always tried to keep a hundred songs in my repertoire.
translation.ko: 레퍼토리로 100곡 정도는 준비해 두려고 했던 게 기억나요

translation.en: At a time.
So that if the band didn't know one song,
they'd know the other song or something like that.
translation.ko: 다른 곡이나 비슷한 곡으로 대체할 수 있으니까요

translation.en: And also I could take requests.
translation.ko: 그리고 관객들의 요청도 들어줄 수 있고요

translation.en: Growing up in a violent household
was…
horrible.
But I…
locked myself away with music
to block out everything else,
translation.ko: 다른 건 다 잊을 수 있게요

translation.en: so that all I could see, hear, think, and imagine was music.
translation.ko: 오직 음악만 보고 듣고 생각하고 상상했어요

translation.en: Probably hearing my mother
saying, "You can make it. You're going to make it."
translation.ko: '너는 할 수 있어 너는 꼭 성공할 거야'

translation.en: I felt like that was going to save us somehow if I made it,
translation.ko: 그럴 때마다 가수가 되면 구원받을 것 같은 느낌이 들었죠

translation.en: and it was more of a responsibility to be…
translation.ko: 하지만 가수가 되고 공연을 하는 건

translation.en: a performer, to do it as a career.
translation.ko: 직업적인 책임감만으로 할 수 있는 일은 아니었어요

translation.en: ♪ And momma never wanted anymore Than what she had ♪ ♪ If she did She never did say so to Daddy ♪
♪ And she never missed the flowers ♪
translation.ko: "엄마와 원정을 간 샤니아는 컨트리 가수 메리 베일리를 만나"

translation.en: ♪ And the cards he never sent her ♪
translation.ko: "엄마와 원정을 간 샤니아는 컨트리 가수 메리 베일리를 만나" "특별한 인연을 시작하게 된다"

translation.en: ♪ If she did She never did say so to Daddy ♪
[woman] I was doing a concert in Northern Ontario,
and Shania was the opening act.
And this little girl, probably 11,
guitar was larger than she was, actually,
and sat down and sang, and I was in the wings and went,
translation.ko: 샤니아가 앉아서 노래를 시작하자 제 차례를 기다리다 깜짝 놀랐죠

translation.en: "Oh my, I… I can't believe this."
I mean, this sound, this voice, the control, way back then.
translation.ko: 당시 모든 소리, 목소리 테크닉이 정말 대단했어요

translation.en: She brought tears to my eyes. That's how much emotion was in the voice.
translation.ko: 눈물이 핑 돌 정도였죠 목소리에 감정이 담겨 있었거든요

translation.en: Her mother was there, Sharon.
And Sharon asked if I would consider working with her.
translation.ko: 저에게 샤니아와 함께 작업할 의향이 있는지 묻더라고요

translation.en: I, I thought then, right from the get-go, that this little girl had a chance.
translation.ko: 처음 본 순간부터 떡잎이 다른 친구라고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Shania] I just knew that I loved music.
I was always singing. I was always being musically creative.
translation.ko: 항상 노래를 하거나 음악적인 창의력을 발휘했죠

translation.en: By the time I was a teenager, yeah, I was on…
I was doing the odd little TV thing.
It's a pleasure to welcome her back, 15 years of age,
here's Miss Eilleen Twain! Let's make her welcome.
By the time I was 16, I was already…
really wanting to sing rock.
Which my parents did not like
because they thought I was going to sing "their country" for the rest of my life.
translation.ko: 부모님이 좋아하는 '컨트리'만 평생 할 거라 생각하셨거든요

translation.en: ♪ Hit me with your best shot ♪
translation.ko: "1981년, 팻 베네타의 '히트 미 위드 유어 베스트 샷'"

translation.en: ♪ Why don't you hit me With your best shot ♪
They wanted me to be the next Tanya Tucker.
translation.ko: 제가 차기 탄야 터커가 되기를 원하셨어요

translation.en: I wanted to rock out, you know.
Wanted to use my energy and get out from behind my guitar.
It was a really tough transition because I was always such a shy singer.
translation.ko: 언제나 수줍게 노래를 했기 때문에 변화하기 쉽지는 않았어요

translation.en: I think, once I started singing rock,
I started developing my own style.
translation.ko: 저만의 스타일이 생겨나기 시작한 거 같아요

translation.en: I was stretching out creatively, artistically,
translation.ko: 창의적, 예술적인 면에서 경계를 확장해 나갔고

translation.en: and it was also affecting my songwriting.
translation.ko: 이는 제가 쓰는 노래에도 영향을 미쳤어요

translation.en: Mare was a big support. She was encouraging me to keep writing songs,
translation.ko: 메리가 응원을 많이 해줬어요 작곡을 계속하라고 독려해 줬죠

translation.en: make more demos…
It was at that time, I thought, you know, she really has it.
translation.ko: 그때 저는 샤니아가 정말 특별하다고 생각했어요

translation.en: She really has something unique.
The idea was to make these demos for…
you know, to get producers and record labels interested.
And…
then my parents died.
[Shania] And nobody could really help me through that…
grief.
[Mary Bailey] It was a devastating time.
Her world was pulled out from under her.
She said, "Mary, I don't know what I'm going to do."
translation.ko: 저한테 어떻게 해야 할지 모르겠다고 말하더군요

translation.en: "I really don't know."
[Shania] At the time, I just really wanted to quit…
[clicks tongue] And…
get a real job.
I've got kids now. I've got kids to support.
translation.ko: 이제 제가 돌봐야 하는 아이들이 있으니까요

translation.en: How am I going to do it?
And Mary Bailey says, there's a singing job opening up at a resort
translation.ko: 그때 메리 베일리가 온타리오주 헌츠빌에 있는

translation.en: in a place called Deerhurst in Huntsville, Ontario.
translation.ko: 디어허스트라는 리조트에서 가수를 구한다고 했어요 "디어허스트 리조트 안내 & 별관"

translation.en: Deerhurst was a resort that had shows.
They did sort of an Off-Broadway production of musicals.
And it was a gig. It was a job.
It was an opportunity to make some money to feed her family.
translation.ko: 가족들을 먹여 살릴 기회가 온 거예요

translation.en: And it turned out that live performing was going to pay better,
translation.ko: 비록 모두가 알 만큼 유명하거나 하지는 않았지만

translation.en: even at this level, at that little level, than, um, working a regular day job.
translation.ko: 그래도 일반 직장보다는 라이브 공연 수입이 높았어요

translation.en: I mean, it was pretty decent paying.
I was able to support my brothers. Um…
I was able to make enough money to put food on the table singing at this resort.
translation.ko: 리조트에서 노래한 덕분에 먹고살 수 있었어요

translation.en: Once I was performing at Deerhurst,
the Vegas-style show
was a whole different thing.
It was the first time I had ever done anything like that.
translation.ko: 그런 공연은 해 본 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: [announcer] Miss Eilleen Twain. How 'bout it? Let me hear it!
translation.ko: 아일린 트웨인입니다 큰 소리로 환영해 주세요!

translation.en: [Shania] It was pretty scary. I didn't really know what I was doing at all.
translation.ko: 무서웠어요 뭘 어떻게 해야 하는지 아는 게 없었거든요

translation.en: I had no idea
how to sing and wear high heel shoes, for example,
at the same time.
I had to learn fast because this was now my new job.
Somewhere in the middle of all of that, I learned
translation.ko: 그 과정에서 한 가지에 감사하는 마음이 생겼어요

translation.en: to respect and appreciate that
I did have a talent that would be a shame to throw away and not pursue.
translation.ko: 너무나 아까운 재능이 저에게 있다는 거였죠

translation.en: I was busy rehearsing, running the kids back and forth.
You know, before and after the show, I would go home and write.
translation.ko: 공연 전후에는 집에 가서 곡을 썼죠

translation.en: There was no other way to get ahead except working my ass off, really.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 쏟아붓지 않고는 앞으로 나갈 수 없었거든요

translation.en: That was it. No other way.
♪ And whoever said That opposites attract ♪ ♪ I'd say they all know where is that ♪
translation.ko: "1991년 크리스마스 당시 샤니아 친구, 가족을 위해 노래하는 모습"

translation.en: All I could do was keep working, keep demoing, keep writing,
translation.ko: 계속 노력하는 수밖에 없었어요 데모를 만들고, 곡을 썼죠

translation.en: and hoping I would get a break.
[Mary Bailey] Shania started to focus more on, and understand
translation.ko: 샤니아는 자신이 누구고 어느 방향으로 나아가고 싶은지

translation.en: who she was, and the direction she wanted to take.
translation.ko: 점차 이해하기 시작했고 거기에 더 집중했어요

translation.en: She called and said, "You know, Mary, I'm ready to do country."
translation.ko: 저한테 전화를 걸어서는 이렇게 말했어요 '메리, 이제 컨트리 음악을 할 준비가 됐어요"

translation.en: [announcer] Nashville 95, WSM-FM…
Well, my debut record was an experience that was pretty much
translation.ko: 데뷔 앨범 활동 당시엔 어떤 기분이었냐면요

translation.en: me as the newbie in town, in Nashville,
translation.ko: 이제 막 내슈빌에 발을 들인 초짜로서

translation.en: treading lightly, trying to find my way
translation.ko: 나만의 길을 찾고 싶어서 좀 조심스러웠어요

translation.en: as an original artist with all my own ideas…
without being, you know, kicked out of town.
translation.ko: 동시에 내슈빌에서 쫓겨나지 않도록 해야 했죠

translation.en: Well, I was vice president of the A&R department
translation.ko: 제가 아티스트 담당 부문 부사장으로 있을 때예요 "해럴드 셰드 머큐리 레코드"

translation.en: when I signed Shania.
I remember the sound of her voice, mainly.
She… She still does not sound like any other singer.
translation.ko: 샤니아 같은 가수는 지금까지도 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: Her songs, uh, I don't… mean this in a wrong way,
but some of her songs I thought were incomplete
translation.ko: 곡들 중 일부는 당시 들었을 때

translation.en: at the time, and, uh…
they were not as country
as we were thinking about at that time.
So we started looking for other songs
translation.ko: 그래서 지역의 다른 작곡가, 음반사 등에

translation.en: from other writers and publishers in town.
[Shania] I was definitely coming from a spicier place as a songwriter.
And the A&R department,
just didn't think it was country enough,
and I kind of had to do a little reset on my expectations.
I didn't cry about it.
I accepted it.
There's not
really that much of my, you know, creative input…
[clicks tongue] …in the album at all.
Um, other than maybe just the way I sang things
translation.ko: 제 의견이 반영된 건 노래하는 스타일이나

translation.en: or the way I phrase things, that sort of thing in the studio.
Even that didn't leave me any room, because they were three-hour sessions.
translation.ko: 그나마도 거의 못 했어요 세션이 3시간밖에 안 됐거든요

translation.en: What could I do in three-hour sessions?
Jingle singers can do it in three-hour sessions.
But if you're trying to be creative… I had no room to experiment.
translation.ko: 창의적으로 하고 싶었지만 다른 걸 시도할 틈이 없었어요

translation.en: I had no room to grow into…
Uh, to grow into the project.
You had a female artist and a female manager to start.
And I don't think that we were taken that seriously.
Shania, welcome to the show. You look terrific on camera.
translation.ko: 환영합니다, 샤니아 씨 카메라발이 잘 받네요

translation.en: -Really. -Thank you.
I think one of the important aspects of the business these days
is presentation, and looks play an important role in that.
And you have the looks to back up a wonderful song.
Is that true, this is the last one you recorded for the album?
translation.ko: 이 곡을 이번 앨범에서 마지막으로 녹음한 게 사실인가요?

translation.en: -No, I lied. -[host] Oh, you lied?
-[Shania] No, it's true. -Good girl.
And this is the album called Shania Twain.
That's easy to remember because it's so unusual,
and there's a pretty picture on the cover.
Joining us now is Shania Twain.
Her self-titled debut album has been garnering its share of attention.
translation.ko: 자신의 이름을 건 데뷔 앨범이 관심을 끌고 있는데요

translation.en: -Yeah. -You look great.
-Sound good too. -Thank you.
You have to work three times as hard as the average guy in country music,
translation.ko: 남성 컨트리 음악 가수보다 세 배는 더 노력해야

translation.en: in order to in order to get a shot.
To be relentless was the only way.
I think that's the only way to be taken seriously.
You have to kill yourself to get there. Is it worth it?
translation.ko: 죽을힘을 다해야만 하죠 그럴 가치가 있냐고요?

translation.en: I don't know. I think that when you're young,
why not, right?
Women in country music,
specifically,
have sometimes been held to a different standard than their male counterparts
translation.ko: 여성 가수들은 실력이 비슷해도 남성 가수들과 다른 기준으로

translation.en: within country. Uh…
Johnny Cash could get away with singing about shooting a man in Reno
translation.ko: 조니 캐시는 가사에 리노에서 사람을 쏘고

translation.en: and drinking himself to death, and, you know, doing cocaine,
translation.ko: 술을 진창 마시고 마약을 하는 내용을 담았지만

translation.en: uh, and everyone would be fine with that.
Uh, and then women were expected to present kind of, maybe,
what would be considered, like, good Christian values.
[woman] I think, especially for a female, if you don't know who you are,
and what you want to say, and what you want to represent,
translation.ko: 혹은 하고 싶은 말이나 신념을 확립하지 못했을 때 "켈시 발레리니"

translation.en: someone's going to tell you.
And that might not align with, like, what you actually want.
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 바와 전혀 다를 수도 있는데 말이죠

translation.en: The music video for, "What Made You Say That?" that was the moment
translation.ko: '왓 메이드 유 세이 댓?'의 뮤직비디오를 만들면서

translation.en: that I grabbed onto creatively,
and it was liberating.
And I liberated myself in so many ways.
Right from that very first video.
[Mary Bailey] She may have had limitations with the music that she could record,
translation.ko: 음악을 녹음할 때는 워낙 제약이 많았지만

translation.en: but visually she really could be creative in all elements.
translation.ko: 시각적으로는 창의력을 마음껏 펼칠 수 있었어요

translation.en: It was like freedom.
It was probably the biggest turning point for me as an artist,
translation.ko: 그때가 아티스트로서 가장 큰 전환점이었던 거 같아요

translation.en: that it was going to be hands-on from then on than anything else I've ever done.
translation.ko: 그때부터 모든 작업이 제 손을 거치게 됐죠

translation.en: Um, because it really set a tone.
[Mary] It's so fresh compared to the other things that were being shown at that time.
translation.ko: 당시 소비되던 콘텐츠들에 비해 너무나 색달랐어요

translation.en: Look at it.
It's like, "Oh my God, how can we show this?"
translation.ko: 도대체 이걸 어떻게 방송에 내보내나 싶었죠

translation.en: I mean, this woman is very sensual,
and CMT initially wasn't too keen on that
translation.ko: 컨트리 뮤직 방송국에선 이를 좋아하지 않았어요

translation.en: because that was brand new, you know.
Women didn't really show their midriff that much
translation.ko: 여성이 윗배를 드러내는 경우가 거의 없었어요

translation.en: in country music.
I was a disruption to the image of country music.
translation.ko: 컨트리 음악의 기존 이미지와 상반되는 콘셉트였어요

translation.en: Absolutely.
I mean, I love it. Also she's just like
translation.ko: 정말 너무 좋네요 특히 어떤 점이 좋냐면

translation.en: feeling up on this super-hot, shirtless guy.
translation.ko: 샤니아가 반나체의 남성 모델을 더듬는 게 좋아요

translation.en: Like, she's like, "I… I run this town, don't worry about it." [chuckles]
translation.ko: 내가 여기 보스니까 걱정 말라는 느낌이네요

translation.en: And then, of course, Mutt. Mutt saw that video, and, um…
That was a journey unto its own too.
[Mary] I say to Eilleen, there's this guy by the name of Mutt,
translation.ko: 제가 아일린에게 말했어요 머트라는 사람이 있는데

translation.en: he wants to talk to you about music.
translation.ko: 아일린과 음악에 대해 얘기하고 싶어 한다고요

translation.en: She said, "Mary, for God sakes."
I said, "I don't know who he is. I think he's in music. He seems to know a lot."
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 말했죠 누군지는 모르겠지만 업계 종사자인 듯하고 아는 게 많은 것 같다고요

translation.en: I don't know who this person is. I don't know his success yet.
translation.ko: 저는 그 사람이 누군지 몰랐어요 얼마나 유명한 사람인지도요

translation.en: I just know that his name is Mutt Lange.
translation.ko: 그냥 이름이 머트 랭이라는 것만 알았죠

translation.en: I kind of thought Mutt was a strange name. I just…
It was just funny. What kind of a name is Mutt? Mutt Lange.
translation.ko: 이상해서 좀 웃겼어요 이름이 머트 랭이라는 거예요

translation.en: It was just so funny for me.
I called him one night. It was one o'clock in the morning,
and I think that it was about 6:00 in the morning for him.
And we stayed on the phone for three hours.
translation.ko: 그 상태로 3시간 정도 통화한 거 같아요

translation.en: Our conversation lasted three hours.
He was playing me some of his original music over the phone.
translation.ko: 머트가 수화기 너머로 자기가 쓴 곡을 들려줬고

translation.en: And then I was singing to him over the phone.
He said, "Listen, we really should get together and write."
translation.ko: 그러다 머트가 말하더라고요 '만나서 같이 곡을 쓰죠'

translation.en: "This could be a cool thing 'cause I love country music so much."
translation.ko: '전 컨트리 음악을 사랑해요 정말 멋진 만남이 될 거예요'

translation.en: He says, "I love your voice, and I think it would be a cool combination."
translation.ko: '목소리가 너무 마음에 들어요 근사한 조합이 될 거예요'

translation.en: I didn't want to be
too forward,
but in my mind, I'm saying,
[whispering] "Oh, wow, if this guy…
[in normal voice] …made my music sound like that,
translation.ko: '내 음악도 이런 사운드를 갖게 해 준다면'

translation.en: that would be the dream. Like…
whoa."
The first record that came out in 1993, I think,
translation.ko: 1993년에 나온 첫 앨범은 "루크 루이스 머큐리 레코드"

translation.en: um, we didn't do very well with it.
I think we put two singles,
it went to 55 on the country chart, or something like that.
She was perceived as another, kind of,
female country wannabe, you know?
translation.ko: 컨트리 가수가 되고 싶은 여자 정도로만 생각했어요

translation.en: [Shania] Lewis, the record label head, was like, "We need to have lunch."
translation.ko: 음반사 책임자인 루이스가 점심을 먹자고 하는 거예요

translation.en: "We need to talk about what is going on here because
you could get dropped at this point if you're not serious about this."
translation.ko: 제대로 안 하면 계약이 해지될 수도 있다고 했어요

translation.en: "So you'd better prove to me that you're doing something really awesome."
translation.ko: 그러니까 자기한테 작업 성과를 보여줘야 한다고요

translation.en: So I said, "Okay."
"I'm working with this rock producer named Mutt Lange."
translation.ko: 사실 머트 랭이라는 록 프로듀서랑 작업 중이라고요

translation.en: Like, as if I had to confess something. [chuckles]
It really felt like a confession, and…
translation.ko: 정말 죄를 고백하는 기분이었죠 얘기를 들은 루이스는

translation.en: he was stunned.
And said, like, probably, "Holy fuck," or something like that.
translation.ko: 그러고는 '대박'과 비슷한 그런 말을 했던 거 같아요

translation.en: And then I think… I was… I'm thinking it could be like, "Holy fuck… no way,"
translation.ko: '대박, 말도 안 돼' 뭐 이런 말이었어요

translation.en: or "Holy fuck, that's incredible."
Thankfully, he thought it was incredible.
Mutt, he was one of my heroes. The guy who produced Back in Black,
translation.ko: 머트는 제 우상이었어요 '백 인 블랙'부터 데프 레퍼드까지

translation.en: and Def Leppard and stuff. Being a rock guy, I loved those things.
translation.ko: 제가 록 팬으로서 너무나 좋아하는 명반을 프로듀싱했거든요

translation.en: I knew about him, and I knew a bit of his history.
translation.ko: 머트가 누군지 알았고 그동안의 이력도 좀 알았어요

translation.en: He was pretty well aware of country music more than anybody probably knew.
translation.ko: 다른 누구보다 컨트리 음악에 대해 잘 아는 사람이었죠

translation.en: [man] And one, two, three…
The fact that I was now writing for the purpose of recording my own music
translation.ko: 제가 쓴 곡을 녹음하기 위해 작곡을 하다니

translation.en: was the dream. That was the dream.
That was the dream that I went to Nashville
translation.ko: 처음 내슈빌을 향할 때도 그게 제 꿈이었어요

translation.en: hoping to find and didn't find it right away.
translation.ko: 바로 찾을 순 없었지만 찾기를 바란 꿈이었죠

translation.en: I was super motivated and very inspired.
You know, all of a sudden, now I've got Mutt, who's really into my ideas.
translation.ko: 갑자기 머트라는 사람이 나타나 제 아이디어를 좋아해 줬으니까요

translation.en: At the very end, do you think you should just wait.
Like, if I went, "I'm outta here." Beat.
translation.ko: '난 여기서 나갈 거야' 다음에 비트를 주는 거지

translation.en: Just a beat between.
We wrote the album very, very quickly.
During that whole process, we got together and
started a wonderful personal relationship.
So, to put it all in a nutshell,
we… we met,
we fell in love,
we're engaged, wrote an entire album,
uh, all in six months.
[chuckles] And married in that six months as well.
So we did so much in a six-month period, it was a very intense time for me.
translation.ko: 6개월 동안 많은 일이 있었어요 정신없이 지나간 거 같아요

translation.en: Mutt listened to her,
and then in turn knew how to make her
translation.ko: 그리고 샤니아의 목소리를 증폭시키는 법을 알았죠

translation.en: louder. And knew how to bring out things of her that she hadn't brought out yet.
And so to find someone that you trust with that,
and that, you know, not only isn't going to, like, judge you,
but is going to help you shape it,
to make it great, and make it unique, and make it you.
translation.ko: 더욱 근사하게 만들 수 있도록 도와준 거죠

translation.en: That's why it's one of the greatest partnerships in music.
translation.ko: 음악계 역사상 최고의 파트너십이라고 할 수 있어요

translation.en: You hear Shania be Shania with a megaphone.
translation.ko: 샤니아가 확성기에 대고 자신의 목소리를 내기 시작한 거죠

translation.en: ♪ Whose bed have your boots been under? ♪ And whose heart did you steal I wonder?
translation.ko: "1995년 2월 - 샤니아 2집 앨범 '더 우먼 인 미'가 발매되었다"

translation.en: I wanted to lead with "Any Man of Mine."
translation.ko: 저는 '애니 맨 오브 마인'을 첫 곡으로 하고 싶었어요

translation.en: I wanted that to be the first single off The Woman in Me album,
translation.ko: '더 우먼 인 미' 앨범의 첫 싱글로 하고 싶었죠

translation.en: but everybody else agreed that
"Whose Bed Have Your Boots Been Under?" would be the safest
translation.ko: '후스 베드 해브 유어 부츠 빈 언더?'가 더 안전하다고 했어요

translation.en: to lead with because it was more country-sounding,
translation.ko: 더 컨트리 음악 같아서 첫 곡으로 낫다고 했죠

translation.en: which was true.
If I would've fought for it, I would've got it.
translation.ko: 제가 끝까지 우겼다면 바꿀 수 있었을 거예요

translation.en: They would have done it. I know.
translation.ko: 제 얘기를 들어줬으리란 걸 잘 알아요

translation.en: I wanted to kick the door down, you know what I'm saying?
translation.ko: 정말 화려하게 등장하고 싶었어요 무슨 말인지 아시죠?

translation.en: I didn't want to just shuffle through it.
translation.ko: 그냥 흘러가는 대로 활동하고 싶지 않았죠

translation.en: But I thought, this is a deeper album than one song.
translation.ko: 하지만 한 곡보다는 앨범 전체를 생갹해야 했어요

translation.en: And I knew that when the public heard "Any Man of Mine,"
translation.ko: 그리고 사람들이 '애니 맨 오브 마인'을 들으면

translation.en: they would then get radio on side.
translation.ko: 라디오 방송국에 요청이 쇄도할 거라 생각했죠

translation.en: Proof is in the pudding, kind of thing. I thought it was super strong.
translation.ko: 일단 뚜껑을 열어봐야 했어요 저는 강렬하다고 생각했고요

translation.en: [Luke] If you do what I've done in my life,
translation.ko: 저는 평생 이 일을 해 왔어요

translation.en: peddling records, basically,
you know when you got one.
You don't have to have golden ears or…
be a genius.
You just know.
Enough so that I could go to my boss in New York and say,
translation.ko: 뉴욕에 있는 상사를 찾아가 이렇게 말할 정도였죠

translation.en: "Hey, I'm going to spend more money than you're comfortable with on this
'cause I think we got a huge one."
♪ Yeah ♪ ♪ Yeah, I like it that way ♪
translation.ko: "샤니아는 할리우드 유명 감독 존 데렉에게 차기 뮤비를 맡겼다"

translation.en: [woman] She came to us…
When I say us, my husband who's deceased now, John Derek,
translation.ko: 정확히는 고인인 된 제 남편 존 데렉을 찾아왔는데 "보 데렉, 배우"

translation.en: um, was known for his photography, especially when it came to women,
translation.ko: 존은 특히 여성을 잘 찍어내는 사진작가로 명성이 자자했어요

translation.en: and beautiful women.
I said, "We're gonna shoot this girl. She sounds interesting."
translation.ko: 제가 촬영하라고 부추겼어요 샤니아에게 관심이 갔거든요

translation.en: He said, "Is she beautiful?" I said, "Yeah, she looks beautiful."
translation.ko: 존은 샤니아가 예쁜지 물었고 저는 그렇다고 대답했어요

translation.en: [Bo Derek] His process was so unusual, and a lot of girls couldn't take it.
translation.ko: 존은 작업 방식이 독특했어요 많은 여자들이 견디지 못했죠

translation.en: It was all about getting the beauty for him.
And he didn't pussyfoot and talk around, trying not to hurt your feelings.
translation.ko: 상대의 감정을 배려해서 에둘러 표현하지도 않았어요

translation.en: He would really cut to the chase and say, "Uh, your nose is crooked."
translation.ko: 항상 이렇게 직설적으로 말했죠 '코가 비뚤어진 탓에'

translation.en: "And now I got to change all the lighting and the camera angle."
If he were shooting me, he'd say, "Stop that, you look like you're smelling shit,"
translation.ko: 저를 찍을 때도 이렇게 말했어요 '그만 좀 해, 냄새나는 똥 같아'

translation.en: or, "Your mouth looks like a chicken's ass,"
or, you know, whatever it is, which would send some girls home crying.
translation.ko: 이런 종류의 말을 많이 했어요 많은 여자들이 울면서 집에 갔죠

translation.en: And I thought, "Okay…
you're going to have to get over this and take it and move on
'cause there's a job to do, a video to make,
and the sun is going down."
[Bo Derek] There was a funny moment on this, when
John wanted her to do something kind of hokey and corny and she didn't want to.
translation.ko: 존이 엄청 진부한 포즈를 요구하자 샤니아가 거절했어요

translation.en: We were nose-to-nose at one point, arguing about this.
translation.ko: 이 문제로 싸우다가 주먹다짐 직전까지 갔어요

translation.en: He wasn't good at being told no.
She was great. She really stood up for herself.
translation.ko: 샤니아는 정말 멋졌어요 자신의 목소리를 분명히 냈죠

translation.en: And he could be a little difficult.
translation.ko: 존을 대하는 게 어려울 수 있었을 텐데요

translation.en: I had a vision about how I wanted it to look,
translation.ko: 어떻게 보이고 싶은지 어떤 이미지를 갖고 싶은지

translation.en: and how I wanted to present myself.
[Bo Derek] She said, "This is my video. This is my money."
translation.ko: 샤니아가 이렇게 말했어요 '내 뮤비고, 내 돈이에요'

translation.en: "I'm going to get what I want."
[Shania] That was actually a tense moment.
I thought he was going to leave and quit the video at that point.
translation.ko: 존이 뮤비 촬영을 그만두고 자리를 박차고 나갈 줄 알았죠

translation.en: Then he turned on the camera and said, "You want it, you got it."
translation.ko: 그런데 카메라를 켜고는 '원하는 대로 해요'라고 했어요

translation.en: He clicked the button and looked away. He was such a brat.
translation.ko: 녹화 버튼을 누르고 시선을 돌렸죠 정말 무례했다니까요

translation.en: He respected me from that moment on more than I expected.
translation.ko: 그때부터 의외로 저를 더 존중해 줬어요

translation.en: And we had a wonderful friendship after that. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 이후 정말 좋은 친구 사이가 됐죠

translation.en: [Bo Derek] That's a lesson it took me years to learn.
translation.ko: 저도 몇 년에 걸쳐서 배운 교훈이에요

translation.en: That if you stand up for yourself,
he'll fight you to the end and then respect you more.
translation.ko: 미친 듯이 싸운 다음에 나를 더 존중해 줬죠

translation.en: It's not an accident she became such a big star.
translation.ko: 샤니아가 대스타가 된 건 절대 우연이 아니에요

translation.en: [Shania] I had a one-track mind as far as my career went.
And as the label started to realize that I was going to
translation.ko: 제가 이 일에 대해 얼마나 열정적인지 깨닫고는

translation.en: go the extra mile to make this work,
they did pull together very hard and very well.
translation.ko: 저와 함께 열심히 노력해 줬고 잘하기도 했어요

translation.en: They were used to a different pace, a different level of commitment.
translation.ko: 회사도 이 정도의 속도와 열정은 처음 본 거예요

translation.en: But I'm like, "This is do or die."
translation.ko: 하지만 저는 여전히 죽기 살기로 일했죠

translation.en: We're not going to eat as much as we normally do,
we're not going to sleep as much as we normally do.
I'm still waking up. This isn't fair!
translation.ko: 아직 잠도 다 안 깼는데 너무하네요

translation.en: Hey, this is Shania Twain. My new song is coming up soon,
translation.ko: 샤니아 트웨인입니다 새로운 노래를 발표할 예정이니

translation.en: so keep it right here on the KISS FM top 30…
Hits don't make themselves. Not consecutive ones.
translation.ko: 히트곡은 저절로 나오지 않아요 연속으로 나오긴 더 힘들죠

translation.en: And videos certainly don't make themselves. [chuckles]
So, it's just so much work.
Bye!
I do remember Luke Lewis saying, "Listen…"
"I think you should do your next video in Egypt."
translation.ko: '다음 뮤비는 이집트에서 찍는 게 좋을 거 같아요'

translation.en: "In Cairo, at the Great Pyramids."
I'm like, "What?"
I mean, this was a dream. It was surreal.
translation.ko: 꿈을 꾸는 것 같았어요 현실이 아닌 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Luke] That wasn't cheap.
I'm still pissed I didn't go. I mean, you have no idea. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 그때 안 따라간 게 아직도 한이에요 이 심정은 아무도 모를 거예요

translation.en: They're riding horses around the pyramids, and I'm at home, going,
translation.ko: 다들 피라미드 옆에서 말을 타는 동안 저는 혼자 집에서 이런 생각을 했어요

translation.en: "What the fuck am I doing?"
I'm telling you, this was an experience I will never forget.

It's a better album.
Come On Over.
The Woman in Me's a great album.
Come On Over is so…

She desperately wanted to go on tour

The intention was to stay very positive, hence the title Up!

You know, there were three versions of it released at the same time.
That was very exciting.
There was obviously a country version, which we call the green version,
translation.ko: 컨트리 버전을 그린 버전이라고 불렀어요 "제이슨 오웬 음반사 총괄"

translation.en: the red version, called the pop version,
and then a blue version, which was international,
translation.ko: 블루 버전은 해외 관객을 위한 거였어요

translation.en: which had never been done before, honestly.
translation.ko: 이런 식의 앨범 발매는 처음 시도된 거였죠

translation.en: And I just found it so, like, inspiring and pretty clever.
translation.ko: 저도 영감을 많이 받았고 영리한 전략이라고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Shania] The video making was also getting, for me, more fun.
[Jason] All these enormous looks that came along with it.
The motorcycle video, which was one of the most expensive videos of all time
translation.ko: 오토바이 영상은 당시 가장 제작비가 많이 들어간

translation.en: at that time.
[Jason] I feel like it was a home run.
I mean, we had a lot of hit songs off that album.
All right, Chicago! [chuckles]
♪ Up, up, up, can only go up from here
For the Up! tour, I was now getting a new influence
from big rock band show production,
translation.ko: 대형 록 밴드 쇼 제작팀의 영향을 받기 시작했어요

translation.en: like Metallica, because now my management is Q Prime.
And they had huge experience in doing major rock shows
translation.ko: 회사에서 대형 록 공연 경험이 굉장히 많았어요

translation.en: with pyro and all of that stuff.
translation.ko: 불꽃 등 다양한 효과도 활용할 수 있었죠

translation.en: So, it was great for me to now get more epic.
translation.ko: 저에게도 더 화려한 공연을 계획할 기회가 온 거예요

translation.en: I think it just got more in the vein of big-ass rock show, you know.
translation.ko: 대형 록 공연과 더 비슷해진 거예요

translation.en: [Shania] See you on the tour, good night!
[Jason] From the first time we met,
throughout the entire campaign of Up!,
she and I became really, really close.
And when you're with someone like that all the time,
you can't help but, you know, be a part of the highs and lows.
translation.ko: 좋을 때, 나쁠 때를 모두 함께 경험하게 되죠

translation.en: And I started to see a little bit of it as sort of Up! was winding down.
translation.ko: '업!' 활동이 끝날 무렵부터 안 좋은 일이 생기기 시작했어요

translation.en: [Shania] It was nearing the end of the tour, very much at the end of the tour,
I was out horseback riding, and I was bit by a tick.
translation.ko: 제가 승마를 하다가 진드기에 물린 거예요

translation.en: The tick was infected with Lyme's disease.
I did get Lyme's disease.
I mean, my symptoms were quite scary because
before I was diagnosed,
I was on stage very dizzy, I was losing my balance.
translation.ko: 무대에서도 너무 어지럽고 자꾸 균형을 잃었거든요

translation.en: I was afraid I was going to fall off the stage,
and the stage is quite high.
So I was staying far from the edge, I was adjusting what I was doing.
translation.ko: 그래서 경계에서 벗어나야 했죠 행동에 제약이 생긴 거예요

translation.en: I was having these very, very, millisecond blackouts, but regularly, like, every…
translation.ko: 계속해서 주기적으로 잠깐 동안 정신을 못 차렸어요

translation.en: Every minute, or every 30 seconds.
I had everything that was on the Lyme's disease checklist
translation.ko: 라임병 목록에 있는 증상은 전부 다 나타났어요

translation.en: to follow up on medically.
I… I was fine.
But my voice was never the same again.
It just…
went into this strange flanging,
you know, lack of control of… of the airflow.
translation.ko: 공기 흐름을 제어하지 못해서 생기는 그런 소리요

translation.en: I… I didn't understand it.
But I thought I'd lost my voice forever, I thought that was it.
I would never, ever sing again.
translation.ko: 다시는 노래를 할 수 없을 거라 믿었죠

translation.en: That was… You know, that was agonizing to watch.
You know, I don't know, I've never felt for anybody so much.
translation.ko: 다른 사람의 일에 그렇게 가슴 아팠던 적이 없죠

translation.en: I've dealt with a lot of artists that have had problems.
translation.ko: 어려움을 겪는 아티스트는 이전에도 많이 봤어요

translation.en: She came to Nashville. She went to experts everywhere in the world.
translation.ko: 샤니아는 내슈빌부터 세계 곳곳의 전문가들을 만났죠

translation.en: In that search to determine what was
causing this lack of control with my voice and this change in my voice,
translation.ko: 왜 제어할 수 없는지 원인을 찾고자 하는 과정에서

translation.en: I was facing a divorce.
My husband leaves me for another woman.
translation.ko: 남편이 다른 여자를 위해 저를 떠났거든요

translation.en: This was your best friend. Allegedly, she had an affair with your husband,
translation.ko: 상대가 샤니아의 절친인데 남편분과 외도를 했고

translation.en: that infidelity led to divorce.
[Shania] Now I'm at a whole other low…
and…
I've…
I just don't see any point in going on with a music career.
translation.ko: 더는 음악 커리어를 이어갈 이유를 못 찾겠더라고요

translation.en: [Jason] I was at my house here in Nashville when she called me
translation.ko: 내슈빌 집에 있는데 샤니아에게 전화가 왔어요

translation.en: and told me that she felt like she and Mutt were going to get divorced.
translation.ko: 머트와 이혼하게 될 거 같다고 말하더라고요

translation.en: It was a really sad…
sad, sad time.
I… I remember it, unfortunately, very well.
When I lost Mutt, I guess I thought…
I was thinking, um, that the…
the grief of that was…
It was similarly intense to losing my parents.
translation.ko: 부모님을 잃었을 때와 비슷한 거 같았어요

translation.en: And…
you know, it was like a death.
It was… It was like the death. It was the end,
translation.ko: 목숨을 잃고 다 끝난 거 같은 거예요

translation.en: a permanent end to so many facets of my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶의 많은 부분이 영원히 끝나 버린 거죠

translation.en: And I never got over my parents' death.
translation.ko: 부모님이 돌아가신 슬픔을 극복하지 못했기 때문에

translation.en: So I'm thinking, "Shit, I'm never going to get over this." Like…
How do you get over that?
So all I can do
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 할 수 있는 건

translation.en: is determine how I'm going to carry on from there.
How am I going to crawl out of this…
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 내가 빠진 이 수렁에서

translation.en: you know, hole
that I've fallen in?
Just like that, you know?
I had to take baby steps.
Songwriting being the first.
Just being able to listen to myself back…
… um, on my writing tapes was difficult.
And there were always just little milliseconds of
getting it.
Lionel Richie reached out to my management
to say, "I'm making this album, and I want country music artists to,
um, re-record them."
We were down to "Endless Love."
"Who do you want?"
"I want Shania Twain."
Not realizing Shania's story at that time.
Just realizing that that's my choice for…
for "Endless Love" and my partner in that song.
Uh, and of course, I made the phone call.
I didn't… I didn't feel comfortable putting myself under that pressure.
translation.ko: 너무 부담될 거 같아서 마음이 안 좋았어요

translation.en: I said no. I declined.
But he kept coming back, like, several times requesting it.
translation.ko: 그런데 몇 번이고 계속 요청하는 거예요

translation.en: I said to her very simply, "I'll meet you in Nashville."
"No, I can't come to Nashville."
translation.ko: 그런데 내슈빌에 올 수 없다는 거예요

translation.en: "All right."
"I'll have you come to California."
"Nope. Can't come to California."
"Where would you like to meet?" is my next question. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 그래서 어디서 만나고 싶은지를 다음으로 물어봤죠

translation.en: I'm on the phone, and I'm like…
"You know, Lionel, I… I just… I can't do it."
"I'm so sorry. I… I want to do it."
"I wish I could sing well enough to do it, but I… I just can't."
"I'm so sorry."
And before that call ended, he convinced me to do it.
translation.ko: 그리고 통화가 끊어지기 전에 라이오넬이 절 설득했어요

translation.en: And, of course, she said, "Listen, let's meet in the Bahamas."
translation.ko: 그런데 아니나 다를까 바하마에서 만나자는 거예요

translation.en: Now, of course, I've recorded in a lot of places,
but the Bahamas would be the last place on Earth I would think about that.
translation.ko: 바하마에서의 녹음 작업은 생각해 본 적도 없었어요

translation.en: I finally get there,
and as I walk in the door,
she wants to talk to me privately out by the pool.
translation.ko: 수영장 옆에서 조용히 얘기 좀 하자는 거예요

translation.en: She's trying to assure me that she cannot do it.
translation.ko: 못 할 거 같다면서 저를 설득하려 하더라고요

translation.en: I'm sort of cursing under my breath, like, "How could you get me into this?"
translation.ko: 어떻게 나를 설득했는지 너무 화가 나는 거예요

translation.en: This is the worst day of my life. I'll never be able to do it. I'm so stressed.
translation.ko: 자신이 없으니 스트레스도 받고 정말 최악이었어요

translation.en: Lionel was not going to give up. He was not going to give up, and I knew it,
translation.ko: 라이오넬은 포기할 생각이 없었죠 딱 봐도 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: but it was such a gentle… It was such a kind pressure.
translation.ko: 그런데 굉장히 섬세하고 따뜻하게 저를 압박하는 거예요

translation.en: But I thought, well, if I fail,
I'd rather fail with somebody that is forgiving and sweet and kind about it.
translation.ko: 나를 용서해 줄 다정한 사람과 실패하는 게 낫다고요

translation.en: I said, "We'll go in this room in a minute,
translation.ko: 제가 말했어요 '1분 동안 이 방에 있을 건데'

translation.en: but I need you to walk in there with me."
"You know what's going to happen?"
"We are going to discover something."
"Lionel Richie and Shania Twain are gonna show up."
It was a lot of pressure. Oh, boy, that day was so stressful.
I'm so glad that's over, and it ended well.
It took me a lot of encouragement
from around me to get me truly
doing it for real.
And Lionel Richie was a big part of that.
translation.ko: 라이오넬 리치가 정말 큰 몫을 했고요

translation.en: David Foster and Michael Bublé, another big part of that.
translation.ko: 데이비드 포스터와 마이클 부블레도 큰 힘이 됐어요

translation.en: Oprah Winfrey was, you know, part of that journey.
Another great encouragement for me was meeting Gladys Knight.
translation.ko: 글래디스 나이트를 만나고도 용기를 많이 얻었어요

translation.en: She's probably my favorite female vocalist ever.
She told me you just got to get on the mic and do it.
translation.ko: 저에게 일단 마이크에 대고 노래하라고 말해줬죠

translation.en: Do it and do it and do it.
I learned that if I could get my voice into a certain place,
with a lot of effort,
it would sustain for at least long enough to, you know, do a great vocal.
translation.ko: 한 곡 정도는 잘 부를 있을 만큼 목소리가 유지되더라고요

translation.en: Thank you. Yeah!
It was a huge commitment to decide to do Las Vegas,
translation.ko: 라스베이거스 공연 약속은 정말 엄청난 일이었지만

translation.en: but it was exactly what I needed.
It's been very, very long time coming.
It's been over ten years since I've been on the live stage.
Let me hear you.
Diving into the obligation to Caesars Palace,
that was a huge pressure.
But I feel like the only way that I would achieve something
vocally from it was to put myself under the gun.
translation.ko: 압박을 견뎌야 하는 상황에 저를 밀어 넣어야 할 거 같았죠

translation.en: [Luke] You'd have to take a sledgehammer to knock her down,
translation.ko: 쓰러뜨리고 싶다면 큰 망치를 준비해야 할 거예요

translation.en: then she'd get up.
She would get up.
[Cory] I think she took it as a challenge.
She saw it as an opportunity, like, "I'm gonna do it. I'm gonna show people."
translation.ko: 다시 한번 사람들에게 증명할 기회를 붙잡은 거죠

translation.en: And the next thing was recording a record on her own.
♪ You let me go ♪
translation.ko: "샤니아는 새로운 음반을 녹음하기 시작했다" "남편이자 음악 파트너인 머트와 헤어진 뒤 제작한 첫 앨범이다"

translation.en: ♪ You had to have her ♪
translation.ko: "남편이자 음악 파트너인 머트와 헤어진 뒤 제작한 첫 앨범이다"

translation.en: It took a long time to be ready to write and record again.
translation.ko: 다시 작곡과 녹음을 할 때까지 오랜 준비가 필요했어요

translation.en: I was afraid to
get back into the studio without Mutt.
So it was really more about
taking independence for myself,
and it was an exercise of…
saying, "Okay, look, you can't just not ever make music again…
translation.ko: 평생 음악과 이별할 수는 없는 일이잖아요

translation.en: because you don't have Mutt."
"You gotta just dive in."
And I was petrified. I really was.
I don't know where I'm going. I'm leaving the studio. I quit.
translation.ko: 어디로 가야 하는지 모르겠어요 그만두고 집에 갈래요

translation.en: I'm just kidding.
So now I said, "Okay, listen, I'm going to not only
get back into the studio without him, I'm going to write all the music alone,
translation.ko: 머트 없이 스튜디오에 들어갈 거고 음악도 혼자 작곡할 거고

translation.en: and just discover myself again as an individual creative."
translation.ko: 나만의 창작 세계를 찾고 나 자신을 찾을 거라고요

translation.en: Like I'd been all of my youth.
It's actually a beautiful day here.
And, uh, I don't know, I was thinking maybe we could have a barbecue.
translation.ko: 바비큐를 좀 해 먹을까 생각하고 있는데

translation.en: Maybe not.
There was a vulnerability to it, and I think, you know, for anyone
translation.ko: 음악에 종사하는 많은 사람이 음악을 할 때 "제이크 고슬링 프로듀서"

translation.en: in music it's such a… It's like a therapy, really, for a lot of people.
translation.ko: 어느 정도 속내를 내보여요 치료와 비슷한 거죠

translation.en: For her it was definitely a moment where she could open up
translation.ko: 샤니아에게도 전에는 할 수 없던 이야기를

translation.en: and talk about things she hadn't spoken about before.
translation.ko: 꺼내 놓을 수 있는 그런 순간이었을 거예요

translation.en: ♪ Because of you, I'm me ♪
♪ All of a sudden I'm something I wasn't ♪
♪ Because of you, I see ♪
[Jake] Shania's talking about lyrics and things that really matter to her.
translation.ko: 자신에게 무엇이 중요한지 그리고 가사에 대해 얘기하길래

translation.en: And I'm going, "Look, it's fine. Like it's okay. It's good."
"It's important to say these things. People need to hear this side of you."
translation.ko: 이런 얘기도 중요하다고요 이런 면도 보여줄 필요가 있다고요

translation.en: Um, and I think that in itself gave her that confidence to actually go,
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 듣고는 자신감이 생긴 것 같았어요

translation.en: "Okay, yeah. Brilliant. Cool. Let's move forward with it."
That was so beautiful.
It was a great experience.
Now is my favorite
recorded work that I've done so far that I enjoy listening to still.
translation.ko: '나우'가 가장 마음에 들어요 여전히 즐겨 듣고요

translation.en: You know what? Life is about to get real good.
translation.ko: "모든 주요 지역에서 1위를 한 첫 번째 앨범이다"

translation.en: [Kelsea] I say all the time,
I do not think that I would have
the career that I have,
and the career that I want to continue to have,
had Shania not been Shania.
translation.ko: 앞으로 계속하고 싶은 커리어도 없었을 거 같아요

translation.en: To me, Shania Twain is a superstar
that I had the privilege of singing with on stage when I was 14 years old.
translation.ko: 14살 때 무대에서 함께 노래할 수 있어서 영광이었고요

translation.en: And she had a huge hand in me getting recognized
translation.ko: 캐나다의 어린 여성 가수였던 제가 사람들에게 인정받고

translation.en: and noticed as a young female Canadian singer.
translation.ko: 유명해질 수 있게 정말 많이 도와주셨어요

translation.en: Hi, Shania. Do you remember me? [laughs]
[Eve] You know, you look at the diversity of artists who she has influenced,
translation.ko: 샤니아에게 영향을 받은 아티스트는 정말 다양해요

translation.en: her tentacles have reached so far and wide.
translation.ko: 정말 먼 곳까지 다양하게 샤니아의 손길이 닿았죠

translation.en: [Orville] Shania never let where she was from,
who she was, the fact that she was a woman,
I don't think she let any of those things define what she wanted to do,
which was make art and make music and do it her way.
translation.ko: 자신이 원하는 길을 개척했어요 자신만의 방식으로 예술과 음악을 만들었죠

translation.en: [Kelsea] She did it different. I mean, she really kicked that door open.
translation.ko: 남들과 다른 길을 갔어요 새로운 문을 활짝 열었죠

translation.en: And I think it shows in the careers like Taylor Swift,
and it shows in the careers like mine, where we followed that pattern.
translation.ko: 제 커리어를 보면 알 수 있죠 같은 패턴을 따라갔거든요

translation.en: Shania's been that woman to tell you that you don't have to adhere to the genres.
translation.ko: 샤니아는 장르의 틀에 갇힐 필요가 없다고 외쳤어요

translation.en: If the label says do this,
your heart says do something differently, follow your heart. She's just awesome.
translation.ko: 내가 다른 방향을 원하면 마음의 소리를 들었죠, 최고예요

translation.en: It's awesome that she keeps doing it too. Not taking a break. I love that about her.
translation.ko: 계속 도전하는 것도 멋져요 멈추지 않죠, 그 점이 가장 좋아요

translation.en: [Shania] I like to get out on the water and chill, contemplate.
translation.ko: 배를 타고 나가서 가만히 생각하는 걸 좋아해요

translation.en: Um, I have to bring the guitar and of course the dog.
Sometimes I just anchor out and, um…
get inspired.
♪ I'm not a girl ♪
♪ I'm not a boy ♪
♪ I'm not a baby ♪
♪ I'm not a toy ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm a queen ♪
I was always very bold and straightforward about what I thought,
translation.ko: 항상 대담하고 직설적으로 제 생각을 표현했어요

translation.en: and my point of view on things as a woman,
particularly.
My point of view in relationships,
the way I felt that that women should be treated, respected,
translation.ko: 여성을 어떻게 대하고 존중해야 하는지에 대해서요

translation.en: and I still feel the same way.
translation.ko: 그리고 그 생각엔 지금도 변함이 없어요

translation.en: So I'm just going to carry on with that message.
translation.ko: 계속 같은 메시지를 품고 나아가는 거죠

translation.en: I mean, I'm the boss of me, man. I take responsibility for
translation.ko: 내 인생의 주인은 나잖아요 내 생각, 말, 행동

translation.en: what I think, what I say,
um, what I do and…
And I'm not going to be pushed around. I'm not going to get bullied.
translation.ko: 다른 사람에게 휩쓸리거나 괴롭힘을 당하지 않을 거예요

translation.en: And I'm going to speak my mind.
♪ I'm not a girl ♪
♪ I'm not a boy ♪ ♪ I'm not a baby ♪
translation.ko: "자신만의 목소리를 전 세계 팬들에게 전하고 있다"

translation.en: I am here in London finishing my album and getting with some great UK talent.
translation.ko: 앨범 마무리를 위해 런던에 왔어요 영국의 재능 있는 아티스트들과

translation.en: Creatives.
And, um, enjoying being in the same room
translation.ko: 그리고 다른 사람들과 한 공간에 있는 시간도

translation.en: with other people.
And creating music. It's really, really great. Great feeling.
translation.ko: 그리고 음악도 만들 거예요 기분이 정말 좋네요

translation.en: So Mark Ralph is a writer-producer,
who has this incredible, unique style of working.
translation.ko: 정말 독특하고 멋진 스타일의 음악을 해요

translation.en: He's got a lot of really great electronic sounds in his productions.
translation.ko: 제작한 곡 중엔 근사한 전자 사운드가 많죠

translation.en: I was expecting that we would write that way,
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 곡을 작업할 줄 알았는데

translation.en: but you get in the room with Mark Ralph, and it's really super organic.
translation.ko: 막상 작업실에 같이 있으니 엄청 자연스럽게 일하더라고요

translation.en: There's no beat, there's no electronic sounds or nothing like that.
translation.ko: 비트나 전자 사운드 같은 그런 건 전혀 없어요

translation.en: There's nothing.
So I'm in the background at normal speed,
translation.ko: 그래서 저는 뒤에 앉아 평소대로 있고

translation.en: and he's just, like, zipping around. It's awesome.
translation.ko: 마크는 바쁘게 막 움직여요 정말 재밌죠

translation.en: I'm bopping around and having a blast,
translation.ko: 저는 한참 신나서 몸을 막 흔들며 작업하죠

translation.en: and I think the fans will enjoy it.
And it's also very much… It's uplifting. It's still a lot of female point of view.
translation.ko: 영감을 주는 그런 곡이에요 여전히 여성의 관점에서 노래하죠

translation.en: [Shania] I'm more swinging back into this space of,
translation.ko: 여성을 위해서라기보다는 나에게 힘을 주기 위한

translation.en: I don't even want to say female empowerment, but more self-empowerment.
I mean, I'm a woman, but I'm just feeling very good in my own skin
translation.ko: 제가 여성이긴 하지만 그냥 이대로 너무 좋고

translation.en: and less apologetic than ever.
I'm feeling good, I don't feel…
Unless something else knocks me down along the way, but…
translation.ko: 또 다른 역경이 저를 찾아올 수도 있지만요

translation.en: Like I always do, I think I'll just get back up again.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 해도 언제나 그랬듯 일어나면 되죠

translation.en: Shania Twain had no business going this hard on this song!
translation.ko: 이 노래에서 샤니아 트웨인 에너지 완전 폭발한다고!

translation.en: I don't care what y'all say!
♪ Really raise my voice ♪
Me too, Shania!
♪ Oh, oh, oh, I wanna be free ♪ ♪ Yeah, to feel the way I feel ♪
